channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hyundai and Kia on the hook for $500 million-plus, millions of anti-theft repairs
item.description: Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison announced the settlement, which was reached with 35 states.

item.title: Meet The Ants That Practice Medicine. Hint: They Discovered Their Own Form Of Antibiotics
item.description: Research shows that some ants have learned how to treat their wounds, revealing one of the clearest examples of medical behavior outside humans.

item.title: iOS 26.2: Apple Abruptly Cancels Key iOS 18.7.3 Update For Most iPhones
item.description: If you’ve been waiting for iOS 18.7.3 to reach your iPhone, it looks like it’s been scrapped. Here’s what to know.

item.title: 33-year-old woman charged with attempted mayhem after Mississippi Walmart sells razorblade bread
item.description: “The health and safety of our customers is always a top priority,” Walmart said in a statement.

item.title: PayPal plans to launch bank serving small businesses around the US
item.description: PayPal files with Utah and the FDIC to launch PayPal Bank, an industrial loan company offering small business lending and FDIC-insured savings account...

item.title: ‘Fallout’ Season 2 Just Set Three Rotten Tomatoes Records
item.description: Fallout season 2 has hit and has already set three different Rotten Tomatoes records for its genre after just one episode.

item.title: Xbox Sales Are Down 70% Year-Over-Year With PS5 Down 40%
item.description: Xbox, PlayStation and even Nintendo are suffering from very low console sales due to price hikes, economic conditions and more.

item.title: In 2026, Every Company Will Need A CIRM Strategy
item.description: The New Battle in Cybersecurity Is Response

item.title: FDA announces recall of frozen dessert pints over possible 'small stones'
item.description: The FDA announced a voluntary recall of non-dairy frozen dessert pints sold at stores nationwide over the potential presence of small stones.

item.title: Texas sues utility that caused largest wildfire in state history, over $1 billion in damages
item.description: The lawsuit filed by state Attorney General Ken Paxton accuses Southwestern Public Service Company, which operates in Texas as Xcel Energy, of neglige...

item.title: In a frozen luxury housing market, buyers are asking to ‘try before you buy’ and having sleepovers in multimillion-dollar mansions
item.description: Sellers are trying new tactics to get the most money for their homes.

item.title: Klarna CEO says he feels ‘gloomy’ because AI is developing so quickly it’ll soon be able to do his entire job
item.description: “My work to me is a super important part of who I am,” Sebastian Siemiatkowski said.

item.title: Dow and Nasdaq open higher, S&P 500 looks to break 3-day losing streak
Why precious metals could be set to party like it’s the 1970s
Ford cancels $6.5 billion EV battery contract with LG
Brent oil is back above $60 after Trump orders Venezuela blockade
Netflix appears to be in the driver’s seat on Warner Bros. bid
US added 64K jobs in November after losing 105K in October, delayed report shows
item.description: The Labor Department released the highly anticipated November jobs report which showed the U.S. economy added jobs despite uncertainty over inflation.

item.title: Scott Bessent says real affordability relief, 'substantial drop' in inflation coming soon
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent predicts inflation relief and tax refunds for Americans in 2026, forecasting a "bountiful" economic year ahead for Ma...

item.title: iRobot co-founder says FTC's opposition to Amazon deal was 'wrong-minded' following bankruptcy filing
item.description: iRobot filed for bankruptcy and will be bought by Chinese manufacturer after Amazon's $1.4 billion acquisition was blocked by the FTC on antitrust gro...

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
